p: The genus Monarda L. (Lamiaceae) includes 20 species native to the United States [ 1] and is divided into two distinct subgenera, Monarda and Cheilyctis [ 2] . M. fistulosa (wild bergamot) has been used medicinally by Native American groups for treating colds, stomach pain, headache, wounds, and skin problems, among many other disorders [ 1]. In addition, extracts of Monarda L. spp. have been reported to exhibit antihelmintic, carminative, expectorant, febrifuge, rubefacient, and antimicrobial activities [ 3].
